cyclone.name: ZETA
cyclone.current_location: about 85 mi (140 km) ESE of Progreso, Mexico
cyclone.trajectory: Expected to turn north then accelerate north-northeast across the Gulf of Mexico, make landfall on the northern Gulf Coast, then race northeast across the Southeast U.S. and Mid-Atlantic toward the Atlantic Ocean
cyclone.expected_landfall_location: southeastern Louisiana coast (between Morgan City, LA and the MS/AL border)

weather_observation.watch_coast: N/A – no watches posted for Mid-Atlantic at this time
weather_observation.warning_coast: Hurricane Warning: Morgan City, LA to MS/AL border; Tropical-Storm Warning: MS/AL border to Okaloosa/Walton County Line, FL
weather_observation.impacted_coast: Northern Gulf Coast eastward through the Florida Panhandle, inland across the Southeast and Mid-Atlantic including Chesapeake Bay shoreline
weather_observation.wind: Gusty winds could reach tropical-storm force (30–40 mph) Thursday as the center passes nearby, but the probability of sustained 34-kt winds is only 14%
weather_observation.storm_surge: Minor water-level rises (generally <1 ft) possible in the upper Chesapeake Bay; no significant surge expected
weather_observation.rainfall: 2–4 inches of rain Thursday with localized higher totals may cause urban and small-stream flooding
weather_observation.other_hazards: Brief, isolated tornadoes cannot be ruled out Thursday as the remnants pass; possible debris and temporary visibility reductions affecting port operations
